com.acrolinx.javasdk.core.server.adapter

Class CheckImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.acrolinx.javasdk.core.server.adapter.CheckImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Check

    public class CheckImpl
extends Object
implements Check
    Provides blocking methods for asynchronous running server check. See also: local running FlagExtractionCheck.

    • Field Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Cancels the currently running check, or nothing if there is no check in progress.
      int getCheckId() 
      CheckResult getCheckResult()
      This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished.

      This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished.
      CheckResult getCheckResult(ProgressMonitor monitor)
      This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished.
      CheckResult getCheckResult(ProgressMonitor monitor, CheckResultTransferMethod transferMethod)
      This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished.
      CheckStatus getStatus()
      Returns the CheckStatus of the currently running document check, or a check status with the state NO_ONGOING_CHECK if no check is currently in progress.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Description copied from interface: Check
        Cancels the currently running check, or nothing if there is no check in progress. This method is thread-safe.
        Specified by:
        cancel in interface Check

      • getStatus

        public CheckStatus getStatus()
        Description copied from interface: Check
        Returns the CheckStatus of the currently running document check, or a check status with the state NO_ONGOING_CHECK if no check is currently in progress. This method is thread-safe.
        Note: It is smarter to use a ProgressMonitor.
        Specified by:
        getStatus in interface Check
        Returns:
        the current checking status

      • getCheckResult

        public CheckResult getCheckResult()
                           throws CheckFailedException
        Description copied from interface: Check
        This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished. While blocking it is also possible to cancel the check with Check.cancel() from another thread, but is smarter to use an ProgressMonitor and one of the other getCheckResult methods.
        Specified by:
        getCheckResult in interface Check
        Returns:
        The CheckResult when the Check is in on of the final states.
        Throws:
        CheckFailedException

      • getCheckResult

        public CheckResult getCheckResult(CheckResultTransferMethod transferMethod)
                           throws CheckFailedException
        Description copied from interface: Check
        This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished. While blocking it is also possible to cancel the check with Check.cancel() from another thread, but is smarter to use an ProgressMonitor and one of the other getCheckResult methods.
        Specified by:
        getCheckResult in interface Check
        Parameters:
        transferMethod - The used CheckResultTransferMethod to receive the CheckResult.
        Returns:
        The CheckResult when the Check is in on of the final states.
        Throws:
        CheckFailedException - the check failed exception

      • getCheckResult

        public CheckResult getCheckResult(ProgressMonitor monitor)
                           throws CheckFailedException
        Description copied from interface: Check
        This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished. While blocking it is also possible to cancel the check with Check.cancel() from another thread, but is smarter to set ProgressMonitor.isCanceled().
        Specified by:
        getCheckResult in interface Check
        Parameters:
        monitor - The ProgressMonitor displaying the current state of the check. It supports also the possibility to cancel the check.
        Returns:
        The CheckResult when the Check is in on of the final states.
        Throws:
        CheckFailedException - the check failed exception

      • getCheckResult

        public CheckResult getCheckResult(ProgressMonitor monitor,
                         CheckResultTransferMethod transferMethod)
                           throws CheckFailedException
        Description copied from interface: Check
        This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished. While blocking it is also possible to cancel the check with Check.cancel() from another thread, but is smarter to set ProgressMonitor.isCanceled().
        Specified by:
        getCheckResult in interface Check
        Parameters:
        monitor - The ProgressMonitor displaying the current state of the check. It supports also the possibility to cancel the check.
        transferMethod - The used CheckResultTransferMethod to receive the CheckResult.
        Returns:
        The CheckResult when the Check is in on of the final states.
        Throws:
        CheckFailedException - the check failed exception
